Functions for the handling of different barcodes. More...

Functions

 checkBarcode ($barcode, $type= 'upc')
 getBarcodeInfo ($barcode)

Detailed Description

Functions for the handling of different barcodes.

This file currently deals with the handling of barcodes and getting the information associated with them.

Definition in file barcode.inc.

Function Documentation

checkBarcode ( $  barcode,
$  type = 'upc' 
)

Checks to see if a valid, handalable, barcode was entered.

Parameters:
$barcode The Barcode to be checked
$type = The type of barcode, either "upc" or "isbn". Defaults to what is passed in the HTTP GET information if available, otherwise assumes "upc".
Returns:
The type of barcode entered if valid, FALSE if it is not

References XMLRPC_prepare(), and XMLRPC_request().

00020                                                {
00021   if (isset($_GET['type'])) {
00022     $type = $_GET['type'];
00023   }
00024 
00025   switch ($type) {
00026     case 'upc':
00030       $result = XMLRPC_request('dev.upcdatabase.com', '/rpc', 'lookupUPC', array(XMLRPC_prepare($barcode)));
00031       if ($result[1] != 'Error: Invalid length') {
00032         if (strlen($barcode) == 12) {
00033           return 'upca';
00034         }
00035         else if (strlen($barcode) == 13) {
00036           return 'ean13';
00037         }
00038         else {
00039           return FALSE;
00040         }
00041       }
00042       else {
00043         return FALSE;
00044       }
00045       break;
00046     case 'isbn':
00047       if (strlen($barcode) == 10) {
00048         return 'isbn';
00049       }
00050       else if (strlen($barcode) == 13) {
00051         return 'bookland';
00052       }
00053       else {
00054         return FALSE;
00055       }
00056       break;
00057   }
00058 }
